00003 // GameCode.h : Defines the entry point for the application.

00005 // Part of the GameCode2 Application
00006 //
00007 // GameCode2 is the sample application that encapsulates much of the source code

00071 class GameCodeApp
00072 {
00073 protected:
00074         HINSTANCE m_hInstance;                                  // the module instance
00075         bool m_bWindowedMode;                                   // true if the app is windowed, false if fullscreen
00076         bool m_bIsRunning;                                              // true if everything is initialized and the game is in the main loop
00077         bool m_bQuitRequested;                                  // true if the app should run the exit sequence
00078         bool m_bQuitting;                                               // true if the app is running the exit sequence
00079         CRect m_rcWindow, m_rcDesktop;                  // current client window size, and desktop size
00080         int m_iColorDepth;                                              // current color depth (16 or 32)
00081 
00082         HMODULE m_LangDll;                                              // the string table resource - loaded from LANG.DLL
00083         class FontHandler *m_pFontHandler;              // the font handler
00084         int m_HasModalDialog;                                   // determines if a modal dialog is up
00085 
00086         int Modal(shared_ptr<IScreenElement> pModalScreen, int defaultAnswer);

00088         int     EatSpecificMessages( UINT msgType, optional<LPARAM> lParam, optional<WPARAM> wParam);
00089         void FlashWhileMinimized();

00169 class BaseActor : public IActor
00170 {
00171         friend class BaseGame;
00172 
00173         optional<ActorId> m_id;
00174         Mat4x4 m_Mat;
00175         std::string m_Type;
00176 
00177         virtual void VSetID(ActorId id) { m_id = id; } 
00178         virtual void VSetMat(const Mat4x4 &newMat) { m_Mat = newMat; }
00179 
00180 public:
00181         BaseActor(Mat4x4 mat, std::string type)
00182                 { m_Mat=mat; m_Type=type; }
00183 
00184         virtual Mat4x4 const &VGetMat() { return m_Mat; }
00185         virtual const std::string VGetType() { return m_Type; }
00186         virtual optional<ActorId> VGetID() { return m_id; } 
00187         virtual bool VIsPhysical() { return true; }
00188         virtual bool VIsGeometrical() { return true; }
00189         virtual void VOnUpdate(int deltaMilliseconds) { }       
00190 };

00205 class BaseGame : public IGame
00206 {
00207         friend class GameCodeApp;                                               // This is only to gain access to the view list
00208 
00209 protected:
00210         CProcessManager *m_pProcessManager;                             // a game logic entity
00211         CRandom m_random;                                                               // our RNG
00212         ActorMap m_ActorList;
00213         ActorId m_LastActorId;
00214         BaseGameState m_State;                                                  // game state: loading, running, etc.
00215         int m_ExpectedPlayers;                                                  // how many 
00216         GameViewList m_gameViews;                                               // views that are attached to our game
00217 
00218 
00219 public:
00220 
00221         BaseGame(struct GameOptions const &optionss);
00222         virtual ~BaseGame();
00223 
00224         // Pausing
00225         void TogglePause(bool active);
00226         void SetPlayer(GameViewType type, GameViewId viewId, ActorId aid);
00227 
00228         virtual void VAddView(shared_ptr<IGameView> pView);
00229         virtual void VAddActor(shared_ptr<IActor> actor, ActorParams *p);
00230         virtual shared_ptr<IActor> VGetActor(const ActorId id);                         // TODO: Make Protected...
00231         virtual void VRemoveActor(ActorId id);
00232         virtual void VMoveActor(const ActorId id, Mat4x4 const &mat);
00233 
00234         virtual bool VLoadGame(std::string gameName) { return true; }
00235 
00236         // Logic Update
00237         virtual void VOnUpdate(float time, float elapsedTime);
00238 
00239         // Chaning Game Logic State
00240         virtual void VChangeState(BaseGameState newState);
00241 
00242         // Render Diagnostics
00243         virtual void VRenderDiagnostics() { };
00244 };

00247 // This class is a group of user interface controls.
00248 // It can be modal or modeless.
00249 
00250 //
00251 // class CBaseUI - This was factored to create a common class that
00252 //                 implements some of the IScreenElement class common
00253 //                 to modal/modeless dialogs
00254 //
00255 class CBaseUI : public IScreenElement
00256 {
00257 protected:
00258         int                                     m_PosX, m_PosY;
00259         int                                     m_Width, m_Height;
00260         optional<int>           m_Result;
00261         bool                            m_bIsVisible;
00262 public:
00263         CBaseUI() { m_bIsVisible = true; m_PosX = m_PosY = 0; m_Width = 100; m_Height = 100; }
00264         virtual void VOnUpdate(int) { };
00265         virtual bool VIsVisible() const { return m_bIsVisible; }
00266         virtual void VSetVisible(bool visible) { m_bIsVisible = visible; }
00267 };

00280 public:
00281         CMessageBox(std::wstring msg, std::wstring title, int buttonFlags=MB_OK);
00282 
00283         // IScreenElement Implementation
00284         virtual HRESULT VOnRestore();
00285         virtual HRESULT VOnRender(double fTime, float fElapsedTime);
00286         virtual int VGetZOrder() const { return 0; }
00287         virtual void VSetZOrder(int const zOrder) { }
00288 
00289         virtual LRESULT CALLBACK VOnMsgProc( AppMsg msg );
00290         static void CALLBACK OnGUIEvent( UINT nEvent, int nControlID, CDXUTControl* pControl, void *pUserContext );
00291 };

00294 //
00295 // class HumanView - Chapter 9, page 260
00296 //
00297 // This is a view onto the game - which includes anything visual or audible.
00298 // It gets messages about the changes in game state.
00299 //
00300 
00301 class HumanView : public IGameView
00302 {
00303 protected:
00304         GameViewId              m_ViewId;
00305         optional<ActorId> m_ActorId;
00306 
00307         CProcessManager *m_pProcessManager;                             // strictly for things like button animations, etc.
00308 
00309         DWORD m_currTick;               // time right now
00310         DWORD m_lastDraw;               // last time the game rendered
00311         bool m_runFullSpeed;    // set to true if you want to run full speed
00312 
00313         ID3DXFont*                              m_pFont;
00314         ID3DXSprite*                            m_pTextSprite;
00315 
00316         virtual void VRenderText(CDXUTTextHelper &txtHelper) { };
00317 
00318 
00319 public:
00320         virtual HRESULT VOnRestore();
00321         virtual void VOnRender(double fTime, float fElapsedTime );
00322         virtual void VOnLostDevice();
00323         virtual GameViewType VGetType() { return GameView_Human; }
00324         virtual GameViewId VGetId() const { return m_ViewId; }
00325 
00326         virtual void VOnAttach(GameViewId vid, optional<ActorId> aid)
00327         {
00328                 m_ViewId = vid; 
00329                 m_ActorId = aid;
00330         }
00331         virtual void VPushElement(shared_ptr<IScreenElement> pScreen);
00332         virtual void VPopElement();
00333 
00334         virtual LRESULT CALLBACK VOnMsgProc( AppMsg msg );
00335         virtual void VOnUpdate( int deltaMilliseconds );
00336 
00337         virtual ~HumanView();
00338         HumanView();
00339         ScreenElementList m_ScreenElements;                                             // a game screen entity
00340 
00341         // Interface sensitive objects
00342         shared_ptr<IMouseHandler> m_MouseHandler;
00343         shared_ptr<IKeyboardHandler> m_KeyboardHandler;
00344 
00345         // Audio
00346         bool InitAudio();
00347 };
